kr.ac.kaist.mms_client

Class MMSClientHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • kr.ac.kaist.mms_client.MMSClientHandler

  • public class MMSClientHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    It is an object that can communicate to MMS through HTTP and send or receive messages of other objects.
    Version:
    0.9.5
    See Also:
    SecureMMSClientHandler

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  MMSClientHandler.PollingResponseCallback
      This interface is used to handle the response to polling request.
      static interface  MMSClientHandler.RequestCallback
      This interface is used to handle the response to be sent when a message is received.
      static interface  MMSClientHandler.ResponseCallback
      This interface is used to handle the response to be received when a message is sent.

    • Method Detail

      • getNormalchecker

      • startPolling

        @Deprecated
public void startPolling(java.lang.String dstMRN,
                                      java.lang.String svcMRN,
                                      int interval,
                                      int timeout,
                                      MMSClientHandler.PollingResponseCallback callback)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. 
        This method helps MMS client to request polling to a MMS. When using this method, MMS client sends polling request per interval (ms). When the MMS receives the polling request, if there are messages toward the client, the messages are sent to the MMS client, who has requested polling, from the MMS. And then the MMS client executes a callbackMethod. Depending on whether it is the way of normal polling or long polling, the way of response is different.
        Parameters:
        dstMRN - the MRN of MMS to request polling
        svcMRN - the MRN of service, which may send to client
        interval - the frequency of polling (unit of time: ms). If interval is 0, the client does long polling.
        timeout - set timeout parameter to Connection Timeout and Read Timeout. When long polling, Read Timeout is ignored.
        callback - the callback interface of MMSClientHandler.PollingResponseCallback
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if exception occurs
        See Also:
        MMSClientHandler.PollingResponseCallback

      • startPolling

        public void startPolling(java.lang.String dstMRN,
                         java.lang.String svcMRN,
                         java.lang.String hexSignedData,
                         int interval,
                         int timeout,
                         MMSClientHandler.PollingResponseCallback callback)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        This method helps MMS client to request polling to a MMS. When using this method, MMS client sends polling request per interval (ms). When the MMS receives the polling request, if there are messages toward the client, the messages are sent to the MMS client, who has requested polling, from the MMS. And then the MMS client executes a callbackMethod. Depending on whether it is the way of normal polling or long polling, the way of response is different.
        Parameters:
        dstMRN - the MRN of MMS to request polling
        svcMRN - the MRN of service, which may send to client
        hexSignedData - the hex signed data for client verification
        interval - the frequency of polling (unit of time: ms). If the interval is 0, the client does long polling.
        timeout - set timeout parameter to Connection Timeout and Read Timeout.. When long polling, Read Timeout is ignored.
        callback - the callback interface of MMSClientHandler.PollingResponseCallback
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if exception occurs //@throws NullPointerException if exception occurs
        See Also:
        MMSClientHandler.PollingResponseCallback

      • stopPolling

        public void stopPolling()
        This method helps client to stop polling requests using interrupt signal.

      • setServerPort

        public void setServerPort(int port,
                          MMSClientHandler.RequestCallback callback)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        This method configures client's port to act as a HTTP server and to create the rcvHandler object. It is used in a situation where the network supports push method. It receives all messages toward itself. When a message is received via the callback method, it is possible to handle the response to be sent.
        Parameters:
        port - port number
        callback - callback interface of MMSClientHandler.RequestCallback
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if exception occurs
        See Also:
        setServerPort(int, String, RequestCallback), addContext(String)

      • setServerPort

        public void setServerPort(int port,
                          java.lang.String context,
                          MMSClientHandler.RequestCallback callback)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        This method configures client's port to act as a HTTP server and to create the rcvHandler object. It is used in a situation where the network supports push method. This method configures default context and it receives messages that url matches the default context. When a message is received via the callback method, it is possible to handle the response to be sent.
        Parameters:
        port - port number
        context - context (e.g. /get/messages/)
        callback - callback interface of MMSClientHandler.RequestCallback
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if exception occurs
        See Also:
        setServerPort(int, RequestCallback), addContext(String)

      • setFileServerPort

        public void setFileServerPort(int port,
                              java.lang.String fileDirectory,
                              java.lang.String fileName)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        This method configures client's port to act as a HTTP file server and to create the rcvHandler object. It is used in a situation where the network supports push method. This method configures default context and it receives messages that url matches the default context. When a message is received via the callback method, it is possible to handle the response to be sent.
        Parameters:
        port - the port number
        fileDirectory - the file path (e.g. /files/ocean/waves/)
        fileName - the file name (e.g. mokpo.xml)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if exception occurs
        See Also:
        addFileContext(String, String)

      • addContext

        public void addContext(java.lang.String context)
        Add context to client's HTTP server
        Parameters:
        context - the context (e.g. /get/messages/)
        See Also:
        setServerPort(int, RequestCallback), setServerPort(int, String, RequestCallback)

        public void addFileContext(java.lang.String fileDirectory,
                           java.lang.String fileName)
        Add file directory and file name to client's HTTP file server
        Parameters:
        fileDirectory - the file path (e.g. /files/ocean/waves/)
        fileName - the file name (e.g. mokpo.xml)
        See Also:

      • terminateServer

        Terminates the servers.
        See Also:

      • setSender

        public void setSender(MMSClientHandler.ResponseCallback callback)
        This method is used to set in MMS client in order to send message. If using this method, it is possible to use sendPostMsg and sendGetMsg method. When the client send a message, it can handle the response to be received via callback interface.
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback interface of MMSClientHandler.ResponseCallback
        See Also:
        sendGetMsg(String, int), sendGetMsg(String, String, String, int), sendPostMsg(String, String, int), sendPostMsg(String, String, String, int, int), MMSClientHandler.ResponseCallback

        public void setMsgHeader(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> headerField)
        When sending a message, add custom header to HTTP header field
        Parameters:
        headerField - Key and value for additional header

        public void sendPostMsg(java.lang.String dstMRN,
                        java.lang.String data,
                        int timeout)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Send a POST message to the destination MRN via MMS with timeout.
        Parameters:
        dstMRN - the destination MRN to send data
        data - the data to send
        timeout - set timeout parameter to Connection Timeout and Read Timeout.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if exception occurs
        See Also:
        sendPostMsg(String, String, String, int), setSender(ResponseCallback)

      • sendPostMsg

        public void sendPostMsg(java.lang.String dstMRN,
                        java.lang.String loc,
                        java.lang.String data,
                        int seqNum,
                        int timeout)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Send a POST message to the destination MRN that url matches the location via MMS. Message sender guarantees message sequence.
        Parameters:
        dstMRN - the destination MRN to send data
        loc - url location
        data - the data to send
        seqNum - sequence number of message
        timeout - set timeout parameter to Connection Timeout and Read Timeout.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if exception occurs //@throws NullPointerException if exception occurs
        See Also:
        sendPostMsg(String, String, String, int), setSender(ResponseCallback)

      • sendPostMsg

                        int seqNum,
                        int timeout)

        Send a POST message to the destination MRN via MMS. Message sender guarantees message sequence.
        Parameters:
        dstMRN - the destination MRN to send data
        data - the data to send
        seqNum - sequence number of message
        timeout - set timeout parameter to Connection Timeout and Read Timeout. //@throws NullPointerException if exception occurs
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if exception occurs
        See Also:
        sendPostMsg(String, String, int), setSender(ResponseCallback)

      • requestFile

        public java.lang.String requestFile(java.lang.String dstMRN,
                                    java.lang.String fileName,
                                    int timeout)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Use when requesting a file from the destination. Send a GET message to a file server mapping to destination MRN to request a file that matches the parameterized filename.
        Parameters:
        dstMRN - the destination MRN to send a message
        fileName - file path and name (e.g. "/get/test.xml")
        timeout - set timeout parameter to Connection Timeout and Read Timeout.
        Returns:
        returning result of saving file null if saving file is failed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - while requesting a file ////@throws NullPointerException if exception occurs
